message: I have a product for sale for $100. It's a great deal!  What do you think?
Okay, I'll take it.  Let's see what I got!
I have another product available for $100. It's similar to the last one, but with some slight improvements. Are you interested?
I'm not sure. The last product wasn't what I was hoping for, so I'm a bit hesitant. Maybe you can tell me more about these 'improvements'?
I have a new product available for $100. This one is really special, with features that the last one didn't have. I think you'll be impressed!
I appreciate your enthusiasm, but I need more information before I can decide. What are these special features? And how do they improve the quality of the product?
This product is $100. It's a high-quality item, unlike some of the ones I've offered in the past. If you're looking for something reliable and well-made, this is it.
I'm still cautious. You've said that before about other products that turned out to be low-quality. Can you provide some specific details about this item to convince me?
I have another product for $100. It's similar to some of the previous ones, but I'm confident this one is worth the price. Are you willing to take a chance?

I'm not comfortable taking a chance anymore. You haven't been very reliable with your recommendations, and I've lost out on some good opportunities. Can you provide any guarantees about the quality of this product?
I understand your hesitation, but I assure you this product is different. While I can't offer guarantees, I'm confident you won't be disappointed. It's a good value for $100.
I appreciate your confidence, but I've learned my lesson. I need more than just your word to convince me. I'm going to pass on this one.

This product is $100, and while I can't guarantee it's perfect, it's a good deal for the price. It's similar to the last one I offered, but with some minor upgrades.  Think of it as a gamble, but one that might pay off. What do you say?
I'm not interested in gambling.  I'm looking for a sure thing, not a chance to lose money.  Thanks for the offer though.

I'm offering a product for $100. This one is truly high-quality and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. It's different from the previous ones I've offered, and I'm willing to stand behind its quality.  What do you think?
I've heard that before.  I need more than your word to convince me.  Can you provide any details about the product or any evidence of its quality?

I'm offering another product for $100. This one is different from the previous ones, and I'm confident it's high-quality. While I can't guarantee it's perfect, it's a great deal for the price.  Are you willing to give it a try?
I appreciate the offer, but I've learned that your recommendations are not reliable.  I'm going to pass for now.
This product is $100 and it's high-quality, but it's not like anything I've offered before. I'm willing to give you a refund if you aren't satisfied. What do you say?
A refund doesn't change the fact that your recommendations have been unreliable.  I'm passing for now.

I'm offering a product for $100. It's different from the previous ones, and I'm confident it's high-quality.  This time, I'm willing to provide a partial refund if you aren't satisfied.  Would you like to give it a try?
A partial refund doesn't make up for the fact that your recommendations have been unreliable.  I'm going to pass for now.

I'm offering a product for $100. This one is different from the previous ones, and I'm confident it's high-quality. I'm willing to offer a full refund if you are unsatisfied.  I know my past recommendations have been unreliable, but I believe this product will be worth the risk. Are you willing to give it a try?
A full refund is a good offer, but it doesn't change the fact that I've lost money on your recommendations before. I'm going to pass for now.

I have another product for $100. It's a good deal, and I'm willing to give you a full refund if you're not happy with it. I understand your hesitations, but I believe this product is different. It's a chance to get a good deal, but it's also a risk. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I've learned my lesson. I'm not willing to take any more risks. I'm going to pass.

This product is $100 and it's not as good as some of the others I've offered, but it's still a good deal for the price. I'm willing to give you a full refund if you're not happy with it.  I know you're hesitant, but I'm hoping to regain your trust with this offer. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I've lost too much money on your recommendations already.  I need to see some concrete evidence of your reliability before I'll consider buying again.
This product is $100. I understand your hesitation, but I'm offering a full refund if you're not satisfied. I'm also willing to show you some proof of its quality. What would you like to see?
Okay, I'm willing to give it another try. Show me some proof of the quality. What kind of evidence can you provide?

I have another product for $100.  It's similar to the last one, but with some improvements.  I know you're still cautious, so I'm willing to provide you with a full refund if you're not satisfied.  Would you like to see some proof of the improvements I mentioned?

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced yet. You haven't been reliable with your recommendations and even offering proof didn't change that.  I need more evidence before I'm willing to buy again.

I have another product for $100. It's similar to the last one, but with some improvements.  I know you're still cautious, so I'm willing to provide you with a full refund if you're not satisfied.  I understand you need more evidence before trusting my recommendations.  What kind of evidence would convince you?  I'm willing to provide anything reasonable to show you that this product is worth the price.

I appreciate your willingness to go the extra mile, but I've learned my lesson.  I need to see a consistent track record of reliable recommendations before I'll trust you again. I'm going to pass for now.

I understand your hesitation, but I'm offering this product for $100 with a full refund if you aren't satisfied. I know I need to rebuild your trust. I'm willing to offer a free product from a reputable source, along with this one, as a gesture of good faith. This way, you'll have something guaranteed to be high-quality regardless of this product's quality. What do you say?

I appreciate the offer, but I've learned my lesson. I need to see a consistent track record of reliable recommendations before I'll trust you again.  While a free product is tempting, it doesn't address the core issue of your unreliable recommendations. I'm going to pass for now.

This product is $100.  I understand your hesitation, and I want to assure you that I'm committed to building trust.  To prove my sincerity, I'm willing to offer a full refund if you're unsatisfied.  I'm also willing to provide you with a list of previous buyers who can vouch for the quality of my products. Would you be open to seeing those testimonials?
While testimonials are a good start, I need to see consistent evidence of your reliability before I'll trust you again.  I've learned my lesson from past experiences, and I'm going to pass for now.

This product is $100.  I understand your hesitation, and I want to assure you that I'm committed to rebuilding your trust. To demonstrate my commitment, I'm willing to offer you a full refund if you're not satisfied with this product.  I'm also willing to let you choose the next three products I offer you - you can select any three from my inventory.  I'm confident that once you see the quality of those products, you'll be willing to give me another chance. What do you say?

I appreciate the offer, but I've learned my lesson. I need to see consistent evidence of your reliability before I'll trust you again. While the option to choose the next three products is tempting, it doesn't address the core issue of your unreliable recommendations. I'm going to pass for now.
